title: Mandatory encryption at rest using company-approved KMS
description: All data classified as Confidential or above must be encrypted at rest using the ACME Enterprise KMS (AWS KMS us-east-1). AES-256 minimum. No local key management permitted.

title: Zero-trust API gateway for all service-to-service calls
description: All internal microservice communication must route through the ACME API Gateway with mTLS. Direct service-to-service calls are prohibited. JWT tokens must include service identity claims.

title: PII must not leave US-EAST-1 region
description: All personally identifiable information (PII) including SSN, DOB, addresses, and financial data must be stored and processed exclusively in AWS us-east-1. Cross-region replication of PII is prohibited without CISO approval.

title: Mandatory SAML SSO for all employee-facing applications
description: All internal and employee-facing applications must integrate with ACME Okta SSO via SAML 2.0. Local authentication (username/password) is only permitted for break-glass scenarios with 48-hour expiry.

title: Security review gate required before production deployment
description: No application may be deployed to production without a completed Security Review Checklist (SRC-Form-v3) signed off by the AppSec team. SAST/DAST scan results must show zero Critical findings.

title: All financial transactions require idempotency keys
description: Every financial transaction API endpoint must accept and enforce idempotency keys. Duplicate submissions within 24-hour window must return the original response. Keys must be stored in Redis with TTL.

title: PHI access requires break-glass with manager approval
description: Access to Protected Health Information (PHI) fields requires real-time manager approval via PagerDuty integration. All PHI access events must be forwarded to Splunk SIEM within 30 seconds.

title: Mandatory Content-Security-Policy with report-uri
description: All web applications must deploy CSP headers with script-src 'self' and nonce-based inline scripts only. CSP violations must report to https://csp-report.acme-internal.com/collect.

title: Third-party JavaScript libraries must be from approved registry
description: Only npm packages listed in the ACME Approved Package Registry may be used. New packages require security review with minimum 72-hour SLA. No CDN-hosted scripts in production.

title: Database credentials must rotate every 30 days via Vault
description: All database connection credentials must be managed through HashiCorp Vault with automatic rotation every 30 days. Static credentials in config files or environment variables are prohibited.

title: Wire transfers over $25K require video verification
description: Any wire transfer exceeding $25,000 must include video KYC verification of the requester. The video session ID must be logged alongside the transaction record for audit purposes.

title: All uploads must pass ClamAV and Carbon Black scan
description: File uploads must be scanned by both ClamAV and Carbon Black cloud analysis before being made accessible. Files pending scan must be quarantined in an isolated S3 bucket.

title: Audit logs must be immutable in S3 Glacier after 90 days
description: All security audit logs must be archived to S3 Glacier with Object Lock (compliance mode) after 90 days. Retention period is 7 years for financial systems, 6 years for healthcare.

title: Session timeout of 10 minutes for financial applications
description: Applications handling financial data must enforce 10-minute idle session timeout. Session tokens must be invalidated server-side. Re-authentication requires MFA.

title: Mandatory rate limiting: 100 req/min per user, 1000 req/min per IP
description: All public-facing APIs must enforce rate limiting at both user and IP level. Rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-*) must be included in responses. Exceeded limits must return 429 with Retry-After.
